definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: The authoress has edited out all references to her own family.
sentences.chinese: 女作家将所有涉及其家族的内容全删掉。

sentences.english: She says fresh pollock is definitely off her restaurant’s menu.
sentences.chinese: 她说，新鲜鳕鱼已经从她的餐馆菜单里删掉了。

sentences.english: Jhon accedently deleted the file today!
sentences.chinese: 约翰今天不小心把文件删掉了。

sentences.english: I was not too gentle, slightly watched on excised .
sentences.chinese: 我当时并没有太过在意，略略看了一下就删掉了。

sentences.english: The copied question should not be crossed out from the old page.
sentences.chinese: 复制出来的问题不要从原来的内容页上删掉。

sentences.english: Here they had omitted the cannons.
All the objectionable words and phrases were edited out of the manuscripts.
sentences.chinese: 所有可能引起异议的词句都从手稿中删掉了。

sentences.english: Can you cut out any redundant phrases?
sentences.chinese: 是否可以删掉一些多余的词组？

sentences.english: The last chapter was retrenched from the book.
But if the deleted, can put you out from the brain?
sentences.chinese: 可是如果删了，就可以把你从脑里删掉了吗？

sentences.english: I crossed it out because it was repetitious.
He excluded certain passages from the original book in the new edition.
sentences.chinese: 在新版中他删掉了原书中的某些章节。

sentences.english: I crossed it out BECause it was repetitious .
sentences.chinese: 我删掉它是因为它重复了。

sentences.english: A parenthetical clause or phrase is one that can be removed without changing the meaning of the sentence or making it ungrammatical.
sentences.chinese: 插入语是一个句子中即使被删掉也不影响句子的部分。

sentences.english: Delete the non-essential items from your to do list.
sentences.chinese: 从你的任务清单中删掉不重要的工作。

definition: to add sb to one's blacklist (on a cellphone, or in instant messaging software etc)/abbr. for 拉到黑名單|拉到黑名单
screenshot/to capture an image displayed on a computer screen
"zombie fans", fake followers that can be bought to boost one's popularity on Weibo, Baidu etc
to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
to break off relations/to break with sb
